title: Development of android apllications for truck driver evaluation
abstract: This report contains all the activities and the final result that delivered while working at DAF Company. The project is to evaluate the driver performance or behavior by using android application. The problem is that the drivers of DAF Trucks are unable to monitor their driver performance by themselves. With this new android application, hopefully the drivers can be motivated to improve their driver performance. The task varies from android programming, up to creating a web server. Chapter 1 explains the introduction. Chapter 2, explains about the company and as for the chapter 3, it explains the details of the assignment and the objective of the application. Chapter 4 explains the approaches to solve the problem and which techniques that the intern used. Chapter 5 explains about the research segment. Chapter 6 explains about the result that the intern produced during the internship. Chapter 7 contains the conclusion on this project and recommendation to the company. In addition to that, Appendices will be provided in the last section.
contributors: HENK AARTS (Advisor 1); STEFAN LENS (Advisor 2); CASPER SCHELLEKENS (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 01021176/INF/2012: Evan Widyanto Tjoa (26408024)
subjects: ANDROID (COMPUTER PROGRAM); APPLICATION SOFTWARE-DEVELOPMENT; ANDROID MOBILE OPERATING SYSTEM (ELECTRONIC RESOURCE)
